However, when looking especially at the OT you will see that Sin And Disease are often mentioned together, example: Psalm 103:3 "who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases,". This is often a common theme. Sin brings disease and disease means there is sin. Why else would Jesus' disciples ask of the man born blind, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?” (John 9:1) ? At this point Jesus seems to break the link, however, in John 5:14 Jesus says to the man He healed at the pool, “See, you are well again. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you.” and connects the two. So who can say for sure?

The fact that we suffer disease is a result of Adam's fall, if you get the flu, it might be that God is trying to get your attention, but then I think you might know he is. Every biblical case of disease as a result of sin the people turned to God. Job got all kinds of smiting on his butt and when his friends linked that to some sin he MUST have had, he said that's preposterous and so did God. God offered no explanation to Job about WHY he suffered ever... He just did, and Job still praised God in the end. There is no hard and fast sin x leads to disease y, that is an extension (or the root?) of prosperity doctrine, and it's bogus.
